channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Footpath Overgrown, 13th September
item.description:
The footpath (public footpath) linking Stoke Road and Hunters Road is overgrown in places forcing pedestrians off the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Hunters Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The support posts on the Swindon Village sign are twisted., 12th September
item.description:
This issue has been reported by other residents. The sign is opposite the access to Attwood Close. The brackets that should secure the sign to the posts are loose. The white coating on the posts has deteriorated and the metal beneath it is rusting. The sign and the posts need replacing before their condition worsens.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Coppice Gate, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signpost fallen over due to rusty poles, 12th September
item.description:
Sign posts rusted and falling over. Sign is in bad shape too, requires new posts and sign to be placed . Quite a concern as sharpe edges and angles and disabled people in orchard house 100mtrs away walk down . Partially sighted as well . Reported 12 September 2022

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Coppice Gate, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree engulfment, 12th September
item.description:
The elderflower trees have once again grown over & engulfed the street lamp no.11. Street light is located along the Reddings footpath that run parallel with the train line. This one is the last one before you turn left to cross the bridge.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 36 Reddings Park, The Reddings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken drainage cover, 12th September
item.description:
Outside number 11. This broken drainage cover is a trip hazard. Please could it be fixed asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Suffolk Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parked cars narrowing the road, 12th September
item.description:
Parked cars along fiddlers green lane especially on the slight bend is causing narrowing of the road , which is getting dangerous especially as you cannot see oncoming traffic and some people do speed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 49 Galileo Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parking on junction, 11th September
item.description:
Cars parking on this junction at the end of the school day making visibility very hard. This junction is also on a bend. There will be an accident very soon if parking officers are not sent to sort this out, move the cars on & issue fines to inconsiderate drivers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 58 Brookfield Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped rubbish, 11th September
item.description:
Black bag and other rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Roundhouse, 19 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Occupant of property 34 Devon Avenue admitted rubbish belongs to them., 10th September
item.description:
Location of fly tipping is in front garden of 1 Somerset Avenue - Mrs XXXXXXXX (recently deceased council tenants house). Some post found in the rubbish had address 34 Devon Avenue on it - naming occupants XXXXXXXX and XXXXXXXX (envelopes photographed for evidence). They (occupants 34 Devon Avenue) inclusive of a XXXXXXXX (also believed to live at the address - fiancé to XXXXXXXX) claim to have paid 2 local lads £60 to dispose of the rubbish. After confronting them a few days ago they said they would clear it up. Someone filled 3 bin liners and placed in a hired skip on the property and also filled the council bin (that had been cleaned ready to lock away in the property as property is in the process of being handed back to the council). They however made no further effort in clearing the mess up (photo's available). We contacted them again (Friday 9 Sept 22) and were assured by XXXXXXXX (Filmed evidence) that he would immediately sort it out. On checking again today Sat 10 Sep 22 the rubbish (inclusive glass) still remain scattered over the front garden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Somerset Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole around Ironworks, 10th September
item.description:
The tarmac has either sunk or broken to form a pothole completely around the drain ironwork. In road heading towards Gloucester.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 36 Lasne Crescent, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes at junction, 10th September
item.description:
There are a number of potholes littering the entrance/exit junction from/to Reddings Park/Reddings Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 74 Reddings Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow lines need to be replaced on Church Road. Before the school outside Boleyn Cottages., 10th September
item.description:
Due to the recent works completed the yellow lines were tarmaced over. This has now resulted in cars parking both sides of the road. This narrows the road and with the excess traffic caused by manor road closed. More works being done. This is the only road in and out of the village.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Boleyn Cottages Church Road, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress, 10th September
item.description:
Old mattress left on footpath

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 40 Persimmon Gardens, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waitrose shopping trolley by Municipal Offices, 10th September
item.description:
Good morning, just found an abandoned trolley by the muni offices, aware there's a ceremonial event here later today so it might need to be collected asap. Cheers, Tabi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 83 Promenade, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Area surrounding manhole damaged in heavy rain, 9th September
item.description:
During the heavy rain today, water has washed away the area around the manhole cover to expose large holes and also seems to have forced sewage out of this drain. This is on the footpath from the A435 near the roundabout with Sapphire Road leading to bramble chase off Finlay Way in bishops cleeve.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 30 Blackberry Grove, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole lane one, 9th September
item.description:
Huge pothole between junction 10&11 northbound lane one. Closer to junction 11.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lower Brookfield Farm Brookfield Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of glass on pavement, 9th September
item.description:
Just outside church

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Greville House, 1 Morgans Drive, Cheltenham

item.title: Traffic cones left on park, 9th September
item.description:
Some lads left these two traffic cones on the park at the corner of Bibury Road and Robert Burns AVE a few days ago. They are by the planter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Bibury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fibreoptics work causing chaos, 7th September
item.description:
Badly positioned traffic lights and lack of measures to ensure junctions are kept clear of parked cars has led to stand offs between vehicles travelling towards each other and I've witnessed minor road rage incidents. Car trying to turn into roads off Hesters Way Rd cannot get into those roads due to vehicles waiting to get out. I didn't witness peak time this morning with the schools being back but it was pretty bad at 9.30am! Better planning is needed!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 117 Hester's Way Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous work taking place, 7th September
item.description:
Fibre optics works are taking place but the barriers that are meant to protect the public are adding to the hazard rather than reducing it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Beaumont Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
